intro: Ebenus confertiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
